title: Yet another poll
content:

title: Re: Yet another poll
content:
I can make my IP address a word.
I can make it "localhost", but then I need to backwards decompile a DNS server first.
DNS means something like Delimited Number Series, which means the dots between the numbers are removed so it's just numbers.
Then each number is a letter, so after a little calculus and math and grammar and the like, my IP is localhost.
My monitor has IP 0.0.0.0 and my cat has IP 172.168.1.257... or it would if I had a cat.
Soon with IPv6 I can make even longer IP numbers like 2.71828.18284.59045.23536.02874.71352 and letter-IPs like "thislookslikeajobforcaptainkeen".
Then I can take on the world.
Thanks?Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
